subject: Programming
title: Arrays the Foundation
description: A short lesson to help you apply Arrays the Foundation.

hook.text: An array is a row of numbered boxes. Give the box number and you get the contents instantly.

buildup.text: Arrays store elements in contiguous memory. Index zero, one, two â€” each position is directly accessible.

discovery.text: Accessing any element by index takes the same time regardless of array size. That's constant time.

twist.text: Inserting in the middle is expensive. Every element after the insertion point must shift over.

climax.text: Arrays are the building block of almost every other data structure. Master them first.

quiz.question: Why is accessing an array element by index so fast?
options: Elements are stored in contiguous memory
The array searches through every element
